resources.string: Tap here to select and install them
Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Data usage, Flight mode
A preview of normal dark notifications
After you examined the result, and optionally sent an error log, you need to manually reboot to finish the installation!
You need to reboot to finish the installation!
Overlays failed to install. Click the info button next to the overlay\'s name to reveal why, and optionally email a log to the support team.
One reason an app fails to install is that the app version doesn\'t match the overlays version. We usually update the theme and add support for new versions within a few days, so please be patient.

In the process of installing or uninstalling the Android System overlay some apps might force close. This is expected, and normal. Everything will work fine once you rebooted after installation is completed.

When using dark notifications, consider that some texts are hardcoded to black colors, like sender names from group chats. This fix adds a shadow around all texts, making black ones visible too. You can see how it looks in the preview above.
Notification fix makes black texts visible by adding a white shadow around them.

Installing an overlay, or any APK, on Samsung right after a reboot will take a lot of time. The device needs around 4 mins to finish all the startup processes. If you just rebooted, we recommend waiting a moment before installing overlays or change background and accents.\n\nHave fun theming :)
You need to reboot manually to finish uninstall.

You can theme 200+ apps with Swift Installer. To get the best experience possible out of the theme, please read the provided informations throughout the app. Make sure to read all dialogs and cards when those show up, and to follow provided instructions when necessary.

It is strongly recommended to disable automatic updates in the Play Store settings, and to only update your apps after a theme update supporting the new versions comes out. This way the overlays will match with the apps code and work without issues. 

Not doing so can result in your apps to start crashing. After you update an app from the Play Store or an external source, the respective overlay has to be updated along if available, else it has to be removed for the app to work again. 

By keeping automatic updates enabled, or updating a themed app on purpose, you acknowledge and are aware that you may have to remove the overlay from an app to have it working again, until the next theme update adding support for it comes out. 

Moreover, before updating your device's firmware or software you must uninstall all active overlays, or you risk either a bootloop, or booting to an unusable device.

You can change the theme\'s dark background color and accent color, along with other specific options, before installing the overlays. Head on over to the Personalize card and create that personal feeling!

Swift Installer makes your system dark, and personal! \n\nIt is very important that you understand how it all works before applying the theme, so please take a moment to carefully read the following guide.

The first install will require you to install all overlays manually if you are not rooted, and this means a lot of tapping. Once the first install is done though, it will all get much faster due to the smart update system.\n\nPlease note that we cannot guarantee a stable experience if you use this app in combination with native Samsung themes or Substratum overlays.

A theme contains overlays, which are what override the resources of the respective apps and themes them. Overlays are installed as APKs on your device. 

The app requests storage permission as it temporarily places APKs on the device before installing them. By pressing 'Give' you acknowledge and accept this, and grant the permissions. 

Overlays for Samsung devices will also include a special permission in their Manifest to make them activate after a reboot.

The Material option sets a slightly lighter colors for cards, dialogs and popups, and then a darker one for the app bars, to distinguish them from the main background. The Flat option instead sets the same color for all backgrounds

This option is only tested on stock ROMs. Custom ROMs are not tested and they might cause conflicts with this option. If you want to try this option on a custom ROM, make sure you have ADB debugging enabled and the rescue script available
Here are some useful links if you need help:
New overlays were enabled at boot. It is now necessary to reboot to make the themed apps reload their resources. Tap this notification to proceed
New overlays were enabled at boot. It is now necessary to reboot to make the themed apps reload their resources. Tap to proceed
Please note that we cannot guarantee a stable experience if you use Swift Installer in combination with other themes or mods!

Root access is required for Swift Installer to work on this device and setup. We inform about this in the Play Store description. You can request a refund from the Play Store, or email us your GPA code for a manual refund, within 48 hours of purchase. Email is swiftthemesfeedback@gmail.com
Turn this off if you use SIM pin
%s can be themed using Swift Installer
Show a notification when an update is available to install
When a new app is installed, show a notification if an overlay is available

Our Swift Installer module allows you to: 

• Install overlays systemlessly, so they don't conflict with other modules 

• Disable all overlays by just turning off the module 

• Theme Gboard easier and better, with a custom generated system theme 

The module is automatically generated whenever Magisk is detected, simply perform a reboot to make it active before using Swift Installer!
Our Swift Installer module allows you to theme Gboard easier and better, with a custom generated system theme.\n\n You can find it: HERE
You need to reboot for SwiftKey to reload all colors
Default Android behavior. Dark lightStatusBar icons. May become invisible on dark statusbars, in themed apps. \n\n Normal statusbar icons will stay white
Middle tone lightStatusBar icons. Will be visible on both white and dark statusbars. May have readability issues on colored or grey statusbars. \n\n Normal statusbar icons will stay white
Pure white lightStatusBar icons. May become invisible on unthemed apps, where the statusbar background is white. \n\n Normal statusbar icons will stay white

Accent linked statusbar icons. Should be visible on both white and dark statusbars, and may have readability issues on colored or grey statusbars, depending on which accent you\'re using. \n\n Normal statusbar icons will be accent linked too
Reboot to load or unload the Magisk module
Android Q is not yet supported for your device
Install all your overlays via synergy
Your device can only run Swift Installer without root by using the Synergy plugin, developed by the Substratum team.
